title: migrate email archive (+10y) to Thunderbird Linux?
content:
Hi all, I would like to leave MacOS and use Linux exclusively in the future. On MacOS I have MailSteward which keeps years of email archive from 5 accounts. What I normally do is export mail from an account into a mbox file, load the data into MailSteward and then delete the mail from the account (keeping only the last couple of months) - I am doing this more or less at the beginning of every calendar year, just to keep email accounts not too large.

I can export the existing data (which is several GB of data - email and attachments) back out to mbox files - to be imported to Thunderbird. As far as I have understood I can import those mbox files into local folder in Thunderbird.

Now the question: how is Thunderbird behaving with these archives while using it on "active" email accounts? Does it become unusable or does it work normally while only using the "active" accounts until I open a local folder to search for some old email? Anyone using Thunderbird with both (large) archive and normal, active email accounts?

Thanks for your insights. Cheers, Igor
creator: panmeri

creator: vodolo

title: Adding background color or other visual differentiation to email-list column headings
content: I would like an option or add-on to make the [Legacy Table] email-list column headings (Tag... From... Subject... Etc.) more visually distinct. As is, they look exactly the same as a read message -- same font, not bold, no color, etc. I support some very inexperienced Thunderbird users, and they have a distressing tendency of accidentally clicking on a column heading, which changes the email-list's sort order -- and often confuses them. I'm thinking that if the column headings had a background color tint (the specific color doesn't matter), it would make it more obvious that the heading row is not just another message. Taking the idea one step further, if the color for the selected sort-order column was a darker shade than the other columns, it might even be more obvious that the headings are in fact a *control*, not just another read message.
creator: gfwalker

creator: pshaw2

title: Gmail + Thunderbird + Focus bug - causes accidental deletion (possibly ever since Supernova was launched)
content:
Let me give a minimal example to create a scenario.

Please note that I mostly use Keyboard shortcuts, which play important part in this bug.

So let us say, I have only two messages in Gmail.

  1. Subject: This is new but unimportant message
  2. Subject: This is old and important message

Now thunderbird synced Inbox as well as All Mail folder of Gmail. And both the folders have same mails.

So: Inbox shows 1/2 (one unread, total 2 messages) All mail also shows 1/2 (one unread, total 2 messages)

As I said earlier, I mostly use Keyboard shortcuts.

  1. I open Inbox.
  2. And read first message (with subject: This is new but unimportant message).
  3. I find unimportant. So I press 'Del' key to delete that message
  4. Then I immediately press 'n' to move to next unread message
  5. Now thunderbird takes me to All Mail folder of GMail
  6. Since All Mail still does not know that 1st email was deleted from Inbox folder, it shows me same email again in All Mail folder.
  7. So I press 'Del' key to delete that message (which was already deleted from Inbox but not synced with All mail)
  8. But by the time I press 'Del' key the thunderbird synced the All Mail folder, and on its own deleted the first message and focus was dropped on 2nd email.
  9. Now since focus was dropped on 2nd (important) email while I was pressing the Del key, instead of deleting first unimportant email, I accidentally deleted 2nd important email without realizing what happened. (Important message is gone without me realizing)
  10. This issue was not there earlier (I believe before Supernova). Earlier focus did not fall on 2nd email automatically but thunderbird completely de-focused the pane. So even if I press Del key it would not delete anything.

I have had many instances of important email going to Trash because of this newly introduced bug. Noticing mostly after Supernova was introduced.

In above example there were just 2 emails, so one would immediately notice that How come all emails vanished when I just deleted one email.

But in reality I have hundreds of new messages and would not realize that Del key was pressed on an important email because thunderbird changed the focus.

Please look in to the bug and resolve

Thank you
creator: amish

title: Just not working
content:
I have a BC Telus account. They use Google for their email service. I successfully configured Thunderbird to work with their Google some years ago. Recently I have had numerous problems and now it barely works.

Sending: If I send a test message with a few words it sends. But any real message does not send and I get an error message about unable to compact folders such as inbox. Another error message is, Cannot save a draft.

Receiving: for the last three days I can receive nothing. When I was still able to receive messages would show in the inbox but would take minutes to display the contents of the message.

I can access both receive and send on my iPad using the same Telus email address.

I think I had an update of Thunderbird in this same time period. Also I have uninstalled a number of large programs. Also moved many large files to an external hard drive. Also moved many messages from my Inbox to trash and emptied trash

Suggestions please
creator: simmonsm
